entry.title: Game: Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4 Golden (Vita, 2012) (19)
entry.content:
Game: Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4 Golden (Vita, 2012) (19)20130611
I played for four hours and got to the next dungeon. I did the
bonus boss of Naoto's and then got to this boss. I died twice
against it and am trying a third time before I go to
grind. According to a FAQ I found, I'm 10 levels lower than
suggested to fight it. I like the way the story is going and I
predicted with dread what was going to happen. Since the game is
now in early November, it's intense that there's just two months
left. I feel like the game is basically over.

Total time: 49:25
  • Video Games
  • Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4 Golden
  • Vita
  • 2012

entry.title: Movie: Alex Cross, starring Tyler Perry (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: Alex Cross, starring Tyler Perry (2012)20130610
This was a neat movie. It had heist-like elements, with the
planning of the villain, as well as cool sleuthing from Cross and
his team. The villain did some very gross and detestable things,
but they kept it off-screen mostly, which I appreciated.

entry.title: Movie: 3 Idiots, starring Aamir Khan (2009)
entry.content:
Movie: 3 Idiots, starring Aamir Khan (2009)20130608
This was a very fun Bollywood movie. Like most Bollywood movies,
the plot is very huge in its scope and lots of interesting things
happen it. There's lots of ridiculous moments but it's all
warm-hearted and fun. I really liked the Zooby-doo song.
  • Movies
  • 2009

entry.title: Movie: Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief, directed by Chris Columbus (2010)
entry.content:
Movie: Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief, directed by Chris Columbus (2010)20130602
This was an okay movie. You can very much tell that it has been
designed to be like Harry Potter, but it misses the mark a bit on
that goal. In particular, the point of the school doesn't really
make any sense and it moves far too quickly.

In general, the plot is ridiculous. There are hundreds of unnamed
demigods who are kids (not to mention how many adults there would
be) and they all live in upstate New York, dress in ancient Greek
clothes (why?), and do... something? Percy has to do everything
alone, rather than working with his father or Zeus (who wants his
lightning bolt so bad that he will start "a war" to get it, but
won't step outside his front door to get it from a kid who has
taken it.)

Nevertheless, I like Greek myths a lot and so this was enjoyable to
remind me of them. I wonder if the book is as sketchy on the
details as the movie is. If it wasn't, I can imagine it being very
good.
  • Movies
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4 Golden (Vita, 2012) (15)
entry.content:
Game: Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4 Golden (Vita, 2012) (15)20130531
I played for about a month and a half of time in the game and did
a lot of social stuff and got to the next dungeon. I enjoyed the
conclusion of a lot of the social links. 

I like how clean and cute the relationships with the girls are. I
would be embarrassed (and probably not play) if they were risque,
but I love the innocence of how the culmination of the
relationship is a hug and declaration of love. 

One complaint I have about the social link system is that when
you make a girl your "girlfriend" and you already have one,
there's really no downside (as long as you've reached 10 with
your other one.) You're really just changing who you will be
involved with in special scenes like the festival date. I think
it would be better if the game tried to make you feel bad about
it with a breakup scene or something.

Total time: 38:45
  • Video Games
  • Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4 Golden
  • Vita
  • 2012

entry.title: Movie: True Grit, by the Coen brothers (2010)
entry.content:
Movie: True Grit, by the Coen brothers (2010)20130529
This was a cool movie. Mattie was a tough girl. I thought the
ending was a bit abrupt and I would've liked a little more
introspection about the meaning of everything at the end. But,
nonetheless, it was cool.

entry.title: Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (20)
entry.content:
Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (20)20130528
The major discussion of Chapter 21 was how aboriginals would
reinforce their diets prior to conception and child-birth and the
effect it had.

And that's the end of the book.

I would recommend reading Chapters 15 and 21. The rest is optional.
  • Books
  • 1939

entry.title: Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (19)
entry.content:
Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (19)20130527
I didn't really get anything out of Chapter 20 either. It focused
mostly on how many of the ills of our food lacking vitamins was due
to not taking care of the soil the way it was primitively.

Something that I've been thinking about recently with this book
(not specifically to do with Chapter 20) is that many of the ills
he observes in modern culture could be considered advantages. For
example, yes there is more tooth decay, but one interpretation is
that in primitive cultures if you have tooth decay, you just die
because you can't eat. Thus, the power of our technology (such as
medicine and the way we can produce food) covers the weakness of
our bodies---which is the normal role of technology. Similarly,
this "defends" the presence (or rather, survival) of those with
physical disorders.
  • Books
  • 1939

entry.content:

The pictures in Chapter 18 were particularly gross. I enjoyed
reading about the way they studied lions and rats to determine
what organs of animals they ate, rather than just the muscle meat
that modern Westerns eat.

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 5 (SNES, 1992) (9)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 5 (SNES, 1992) (9)20130524
Today I played for about six hours (in two chunks) and beat the
game. I played from the Solitary Island Temple to the end of the
game.

It really is remarkable how this game is connected to Final
Fantasy 6. There's Gogo. The final boss is made of many pieces
sticking out in a weird way. A lot of the same summoned monsters
are secret bosses. It's very cool.

I was able to beat the last few bosses by spamming Bahamut while
on Haste2, with the other characters providing backup. Some of
them were very nerve-wracking. I think the most tense part, other
than the final battle (which I did in one try), was getting from
the Castle save spot to the Necrophobe save spot. The *REDACTED* Prince
boss was very hard.

I beat the game at just level 36, which seems very low. I wasn't
able to beat the optional bosses Omega or Shinryuu and I didn't
try to go find Phoenix. 

This is definitely an amazing game that fits within the Final
Fantasy canon for me. I think I will continue to play it far into
the future. Next time I think I'll try a different class
configuration though. For instance, I never used the Magic
Knight, Dragon Knight, or even Black magic.

I'm a bit surprised I was able to beat it in just 27 hours, with
basically no grinding after I mastered my classes and even before
then, I mainly did grinding for gold. There's a lot of power in
the job system.

Total time: 27:28
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 5
  • SNES
  • 1992
